verses.roman:
rājan viddhy atithīn prāptān
arthino dūram āgatān
tan naḥ prayaccha bhadraṁ te
yad vayaṁ kāmayāmahe

synonyms: rājan—O King; viddhi—please know; atithīn—guests; prāptān—arrived; arthinaḥ—desirous of gain; dūram—from far away; āgatān—come; tat—that; naḥ—to us; prayaccha—please grant; bhadram—all good, te-unto you; yat—whatever; vayam—we; kāmayāmahe—are desiring.
translation: [Kṛṣṇa, Arjuna and Bhīma said:] O King, know us to be needy guests who have come to you from afar. We wish all good unto you. Please grant us whatever we desire.
